Spending a week in Spain, someplace is going to be the worst meal. This was it for us.  The "tomato bread" was the worst -- soggy pieces of wheat bread, soaked in olive oil (literally dripping), with smudges of tomato on top.  We had far better tomato bread elsewhere.  I ordered the black risotto with cuttlefish, and it was okay but not particularly tasty -- and again, I had much better elsewhere.  My wife ordered the steak with the reduced wine sauce which was so sweet that it tasted candied.  The service was barely adequate. Casa Alfonso wasn't *terrible* (except for the tomato bread).  It's just that Barcelona is really great in general, and Casa Alfonso was kind of the Denny's of Barcelona cuisine.  It was okay, but you could do much better.  Definitely not a 4 or 5 star experience.
